intro: Duroia petiolaris, commonly known as the red-eyed wonder, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking red bracts that enclose its small, white flowers, making it a popular ornamental plant. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Duroia petiolaris thrives in humid, shady environments and requires well-drained, acidic soil for optimal growth.
